results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.

results.title: A Birthday tribute to Shostakovich
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and C B S Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
To celebrate the birthday of a famous Russian composer, Shostakovich, the New York Philharmonic under Leonard Bernstein plays part of the former’s Symphony No 7 (the Leningrad Symphony). This is followed by all of Symphony No 9. Bernstein also gives a sound illustrated lesson in musical theory.

results.title: Thomas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”
Thomas, a child of 2 years and 4 months spends ten days in foster care, in a family situation, He understands the reasons for the separation, and maintains a clear image of his absent mother.

group_siblings.title: Lucy

results.title: Lucy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
Lucy, 21 months and in foster care for 19 days, is too young to carry a clear image of the absent mother and readily accepts her foster mother’s care. The film shows in dramatic fashion the conflict of emotions that Lucy experiences when required to leave her foster mother’s care even though she is happy to return to her natural mother.

results.title: John
results.creator_credit: James Robertson, Joyce Robertson and Tavistock Institute of Human Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
A nine day record of the changes in the behaviour of a 17 months old boy in a residential nursery. Interesting observation of a young child experiencing pain of separation from loving parents. Commentary by Joyce Robertson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Robertson, Joyce Robertson and Tavistock Institute of Human Relations

results.title: Holland: a traditional menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Generations ago, a harsh climate and back-breaking farmwork inspired Dutch cooks to develop hearty, nutritious dishes. Much of the hardship has subsided, but the traditional foods are still a favourite with the Dutch. Chef Hans Clemens prepares one mouth-watering meal.
results.description:
